definition: lit. if you can't eat it all, you'll have to take it home (idiom)/fig. you'll have to take the consequences
pinyin: chi1 bu5 liao3 dou1 zhe5 zou3

definition: variant of 吃[chi1]
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
(negative prefix)/not/no
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
unofficial variant of 瞭[liao4]
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly
(of eyes) bright/clear-sighted/to understand clearly
old variant of 兜[dou1]
pocket/bag/to wrap up or hold in a bag/to move in a circle/to canvas or solicit/to take responsibility for/to disclose in detail/combat armor (old)
(chess) move/trick/all right!/(dialect) to add
to wear (clothes)/to contact/to use/to apply
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: You're gonna get it good today.
sentences.chinese: 今天你要吃不了兜着走了。

sentences.english: You'd better not do it again, or you'll hear of it.
sentences.chinese: 你最好不要再干了，否则你要吃不了兜着走。

sentences.english: You boys are going to be in so much trouble if you don't sit back in those seats.
sentences.chinese: 如果你们再不回到座位上，我让你们吃不了兜着走。

definition: to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to offend
to suffer/to suffer for one's actions/to pay dearly/to burn one's fingers
lit. for one's face to reach rock bottom/to be thoroughly discredited (idiom)
to forgive easily/to let off lightly (often with negative: you won't get away with it)
to be unable to extricate oneself gracefully/to be put on the spot/to be embarrassed
to leave the matter at that/to be prepared to let go/to be willing to take things lying down
to be thoroughly discredited/to fall into disrepute
not to be trifled with/not to be pushed around/stand no nonsense
more likely than not/quite possible/on the cards
to create a big disturbance
to play tricks on sb
to meet with unexpected failure (idiom)/to fail miserably (where failure was not expected)
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
to cost one dearly/to end disastrously/to pay bitterly
lit. to try to steal a chicken only to end up losing the rice used to lure it (idiom)/fig. to try to gain an advantage only to end up worse off/to go for wool and come back shorn
pinyin: tou1 ji1 bu4 cheng2 shi2 ba3 mi3
